text.p: These are some of the leading stories in the Greek Cypriot press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these reports and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- High-level agreeements, United Nations resolutions, a set of ideas and two informal notes from U.N. Secretary-general Kofi Annan are on the table for discussion with the Turkish Cypriots, says President Glafcos Clerides.
- One in four Cypriots runs the risk of developing one form of cancer or another in his lifetime.
- Britain's High Commissioner to Cyprus David Madden welcomes Clerides's statement condemning the violent clashes at the British base of Episkopi this week.

- Enemies of rapproachement with the Turkish Cypriots further the partition of Cyprus, says Communist Akel. An anti-occupation movement plans to protest an Akel-sponsored concert later Thursday with Greek and Turkish musicians.
- The United Nations is using the set of ideas as the basis for sounding out the positions of the Greek and Turkish Cypriot sides during the proximity talks.
- The Democratic Party, the junior government partner meets today to debate the possibility of quitting the government for being kept in the dark about progress on the proximity talks.
